thread.section_title: Stock Market & Finance News - Wall Street Journal
thread.title: The Rise of Bitcoin Factories: Mining for the Masses

author: Stephanie Yang
title: The Rise of Bitcoin Factories: Mining for the Masses
text:
Michael Poteat, an engineering student at Old Dominion University in Norfolk, Va., decided to start mining bitcoin four months ago.
Using some of his bitcoin holdings, he purchased 20 “mining rigs,” computing boxes that solve complex equations to generate new coins.
But while running one rig, he kept tripping the circuit breaker in his home.... RELATED VIDEO Bitcoin vs. Regulators: Who Will Win? The WSJ's Steven Russolillo travels the world (sort of) to see how regulators are responding to the remarkable rise of cryptocurrencies. Video: Sharon Shi and Crystal Tai
